playn.core.gl

Class GLShader

  • java.lang.Object
    • playn.core.gl.GLShader
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    IndexedTrisShader, QuadShader

    public abstract class GLShader
extends Object
    Defines the interface to shaders used by the GL core. The general usage contract for a shader is the following series of calls:
    • One or more of the following call pairs:
      prepareTexture(int, int) or prepareColor(int) followed by addQuad(float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float) or addTriangles(playn.core.InternalTransform, float[], float, float, int[]).
    • A call to flush() to send everything to the GPU.
      • Because a shader may be prepared multiple times, care should be taken to avoid rebinding the shader program, uniforms, attributes, etc. if a shader is bound again before being flushed. The base implementation takes care of this, as well as provides a framework for handling the small variance between texture and color shaders (GLShader.Core, GLShader.Extras).

      • addTriangles

        public void addTriangles(InternalTransform local,
                float[] xys,
                float tw,
                float th,
                int[] indices)
        Adds a collection of triangles to the current render operation.
        Parameters:
        xys - a list of x/y coordinates as: [x1, y1, x2, y2, ...].
        tw - the width of the texture for which we will auto-generate texture coordinates.
        th - the height of the texture for which we will auto-generate texture coordinates.
        indices - the index of the triangle vertices in the supplied xys array. This must be in proper winding order for OpenGL rendering.

      • addTriangles

        public void addTriangles(InternalTransform local,
                float[] xys,
                float[] sxys,
                int[] indices)
        Adds a collection of triangles to the current render operation.
        Parameters:
        xys - a list of x/y coordinates as: [x1, y1, x2, y2, ...].
        sxys - a list of sx/sy texture coordinates as: [sx1, sy1, sx2, sy2, ...]. This must be of the same length as xys.
        indices - the index of the triangle vertices in the supplied xys array. This must be in proper winding order for OpenGL rendering.

      • reference

        public void reference()
        Notes that this shader is in use by a layer. This is used for reference counted resource management. When all layers release a shader, it can destroy its shader programs and release the GL resources it uses.

      • release

        public void release()
        Notes that this shader is no longer in use by a layer. This is used for reference counted resource management. When all layers release a shader, it can destroy its shader programs and release the GL resources it uses.

      • clearProgram

        public void clearProgram()
        Destroys this shader's programs and releases any GL resources. The programs will be recreated if the shader is used again. If a shader is used in a Surface, where it cannot be reference counted, the caller may wish to manually clear its GL resources when it knows the shader will no longer be used. Alternatively, the resources will be reclaimed when this shader is garbage collected.

      • createCores

        public void createCores()
        Forces the creation of our shader cores. Used during GLContext.init to determine whether we need to fall back to a less sophisticated quad shader.
